metadata.author: Barracuda
metadata.comments: Solution template for Barracuda CloudGen Firewall

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Barracuda CloudGen Firewall data connector with template
Barracuda CloudGen Firewall data connector with template version 2.0.1

connectorUiConfig.title: Barracuda CloudGen Firewall
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Barracuda CloudGen Firewall (CGFW) connector allows you to easily connect your Barracuda CGFW logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: These queries and workbooks are dependent on a parser based on Kusto to work as expected. â€‹Follow the steps to use this Kusto functions alias CGFWFirewallActivity in queries and workbooks [Follow steps to get this Kusto functions>](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-parser)

sampleQueries.query:
CGFWFirewallActivity
            | extend User = coalesce(User, "Unauthenticated") 
                    | summarize count() by User
                    | take 10

CGFWFirewallActivity
            | where isnotempty(Application)
                    | summarize count() by Application
                    | take 10

value:
CGFWFirewallActivity
   |where TimeGenerated > ago(3d)
    |take 1
   | project IsConnected = true

dataTypes.name: Syslog (Barracuda)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CGFWFirewallActivity
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

customs.name: Barracuda CloudGen Firewall
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow these steps](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-parser) to create the Kusto functions alias, **CGFWFirewallActivity**

Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux

instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
3.  Click **Save**.
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected

instructionSteps.description:
[Follow instructions](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-connector) to configure syslog streaming. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux machine with the Azure
    Sentinel agent installed for the Destination IP address.
instructionSteps.title: Configure and connect the Barracuda CloudGen Firewall

connectorUiConfig.title: Barracuda CloudGen Firewall
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Barracuda CloudGen Firewall (CGFW) connector allows you to easily connect your Barracuda CGFW logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.

dataTypes.name: Syslog (Barracuda)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CGFWFirewallActivity
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CGFWFirewallActivity
   |where TimeGenerated > ago(3d)
    |take 1
   | project IsConnected = true

sampleQueries.query:
CGFWFirewallActivity
            | extend User = coalesce(User, "Unauthenticated") 
                    | summarize count() by User
                    | take 10

CGFWFirewallActivity
            | where isnotempty(Application)
                    | summarize count() by Application
                    | take 10

customs.name: Barracuda CloudGen Firewall
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow these steps](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-parser) to create the Kusto functions alias, **CGFWFirewallActivity**

Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux

instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
3.  Click **Save**.
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected

instructionSteps.description:
[Follow instructions](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-connector) to configure syslog streaming. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux machine with the Azure
    Sentinel agent installed for the Destination IP address.
instructionSteps.title: Configure and connect the Barracuda CloudGen Firewall

connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: These queries and workbooks are dependent on a parser based on Kusto to work as expected. â€‹Follow the steps to use this Kusto functions alias CGFWFirewallActivity in queries and workbooks [Follow steps to get this Kusto functions>](https://aka.ms/sentinel-barracudacloudfirewall-parser)

metadata.description: This workbook provides Barracuda Security Insights on Log Analytics Query Logs
